tweets.html:
CNN's daytime news is like a reunion for the cute young actors from Old Navy Commercials.

— John Fugelsang (@JohnFugelsang) March 31, 2011

tweets.author_name: That One Santa Claus That Beat The Martians
tweets.html:
@ditzkoff Temple Grandin is like the redshirt freshman who stays in school for like 6 years... of award winners.

— That One Santa Claus That Beat The Martians (@captainkicker) March 31, 2011

Tonight's new episode of #bigbangtheory includes crime and mayhem. It's for all of you who were requesting more crime and mayhem.

— Bill Prady (@billprady) March 31, 2011

If advertisers could learn to love people over forty, the TV business would get a lot easier.

— Noah Hawley (@noahhawley) March 31, 2011

I'm watching baseball on television. Everything is going to be fine, now.

— Ken Tremendous (@KenTremendous) March 31, 2011

Going in to read for the Aflac duck RIGHT NOW. #deargod

— James Urbaniak (@JamesUrbaniak) March 31, 2011

It's for the Aflac duck, not Hamlet. RT @SuperJaneEyre @JamesUrbaniak Auditions only last 8 minutes?

— James Urbaniak (@JamesUrbaniak) March 31, 2011

TV drama showrunners should have to give back part of salary every time they use music catalogue for emotion instead of writing something.

— Ken Pisani (@kpsmartypants) March 31, 2011

I think it's instructive that I got 100+ new followers off a tweet involving masturbation and so far none off a Peabody.

— Mike Royce (@MikeRoyce) March 31, 2011

Rats. Another year without a Peabody Award. All that wasted effort building a time machine and teaching that dog to talk...

— Hart Hanson (@HartHanson) March 31, 2011

@HartHanson I missed that episode. Who was the murderer? The talking dog or the time machine?

— Annie Stamell (@stamos) March 31, 2011

@HartHanson Sorry. Maybe next time!

— Peabody Awards (@PeabodyAwards) March 31, 2011

This is my single favorite tweet of all time because it made me laugh out loud: RT/ @Peabody_Awards @HartHanson Sorry. Maybe next time!

— Hart Hanson (@HartHanson) March 31, 2011

It's cool. I don't have room on my mantel for a Peabody.

— Amy Berg (@bergopolis) March 31, 2011

@bergopolis There's always next year!

— Peabody Awards (@PeabodyAwards) March 31, 2011

Wait a minute, looks like @Peabody_Awards is telling everyone "next year." What about me? I want in! Is next year my year?

— Annie Stamell (@stamos) March 31, 2011

I wish Seacrest would just be honest - "Ladies & Gentlemen, it's 'Shittier Versions of Popular Songs' night here on AMERICAN IDOL!"

— Patrick Walsh (@thepatrickwalsh) March 31, 2011

My DVD player refuses to play reboot of "LOLA." Claims it's "dirty." But "Paul Reiser Show"? No problem. #everythingsacritic

— Ellen Gray (@elgray) March 31, 2011

Betty White to host a prank show for NBC? She's 89! If she drops dead in the street, people will now think it's a practical joke. Bad idea.

— Dan Owen (@danowen79) March 31, 2011

With the aid of a physical therapist, Betty White just jumped the shark.

— Nancy Franklin (@nancyfranklin) March 31, 2011

GOP presidential field just needs to add Ted Nugent for a pretty solid Big Brother House.

— pourmecoffee (@pourmecoffee) March 31, 2011

Secret deal point: AMC agrees to give Matt Weiner nickle bonus for every Mad Men deal/no deal tweet in last 24 hrs. #ItsApril1Somewhere

— Melissa Grego (@melissagrego) March 31, 2011

“@moryan: AMC has reached a deal with Matthew Weiner for #MadMen. A nation rejoices.” // Or at the very least, 2mil people + the TCA.

— Adam Barken (@adambarken) March 31, 2011

@adambarken Hey, that's 4 million after DVR numbers are crunched!

— Noel Kirkpatrick (@noelrk) March 31, 2011

@theshoresofme Breaking Bad, scmaking shmad. When do I get more Spaced?

— Rowan Kaiser (@RowanKaiser) March 31, 2011

@theshoresofme He should probably get off Twitter and go make more Spaced.

— Rowan Kaiser (@RowanKaiser) March 31, 2011

I'm watching #Idol , but I wish I had a small timer in the corner of the TV that said "Time before Adam loses his shit" #GreysAnatomy

— Adam Wright (@TVDoneWright) April 1, 2011

"baseball baseball baseball MAD MEN? Mad Men! MAD MEN! BASEBALL! BASEBALL!" - Everyone, right now

— Annie Stamell (@stamos) April 1, 2011

Guessing creators of "Walking Dead" are looking at "Mad Men" deal and licking their lips.

— Joe Flint (@JBFlint) April 1, 2011

@franklinavenue That's two minutes of Draper staring at a cup of coffee out the window!

— Joe Flint (@JBFlint) April 1, 2011

Would there be this much ink if say the show runner of NCIS had signed a new deal after a tough contract negotiation?

— Joe Flint (@JBFlint) April 1, 2011

the history channel now has a show called "Swamp People." that's all.

— Kate Burke (@thisiskateburke) April 1, 2011

They are singing Teenage Dream in front of Steven Tyler. Awkward.... #Idol

— Adam Wright (@TVDoneWright) April 1, 2011

None of these kids come remotely close to Fantasia. NOT. EVEN. CLOSE.

— Denise Martin (@denisemartin) April 1, 2011

Is Fantasia actually singing a song about collard greens and cornbread? #AmericanIdol #TheMindReels

— Michael O'Connell (@mikeylikestv) April 1, 2011

Fantasia Barrino is both ridiculously good and making me want to take a trip over to Roscoe's.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) April 1, 2011

For the first time in #IDOL history someone sang AND ate a song at the same time.

— Masked Scheduler (@maskedscheduler) April 1, 2011

Haley. Stop. Growling. Just stop.

— Denise Martin (@denisemartin) April 1, 2011

@denisemartin Stop hating and learn to love The Haley.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) April 1, 2011

@HitFixDaniel @richardrushfield rawr rawr rawr. painful.

— Denise Martin (@denisemartin) April 1, 2011

@denisemartin Rawr. Rawr. Rawr. Hot. And don't forget the yodeling. And the hissing. Haley's more than just a growler.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) April 1, 2011

I love this "if you don't have an iPhone, you don't deserve to live" ad. Very inspirational.

— Adam Wright (@TVDoneWright) April 1, 2011

Just realized how much better "Top Chef" would be if it were, "Pack your knives and stay," and losers had to just hang around the kitchen.

— Tim Carvell (@timcarvell) April 1, 2011

Paul sounds like when you squeeze a cat hard. Or when you step on it. Hard. #Idol

— Adam Wright (@TVDoneWright) April 1, 2011

This performance was suppose to convince #Idol viewers to go see Rio in theaters, but I suspect it'll do the opposite.

— Wes Ambrecht (@iamwesley) April 1, 2011

No, Jamie Foxx. No. NO.

— John Moe (@johnmoe) April 1, 2011

Ratings for #Mobbed would be much higher tonight if the girl said "NO" during the proposal.

— Adam Wright (@TVDoneWright) April 1, 2011

Howie Mandel is about to "shatter the concept of intimacy." #shudder

— Michael O'Connell (@mikeylikestv) April 1, 2011

I hope everyone has had a chance to partake in Howie Mandel's fever dream, Mobbed.

— Daniel Walters (@danieltwalters) April 1, 2011

Congratulations Howie Mandel, you've made mob dancing creepy. Couldn't you just be happy ruining stand-up?

— Brent Piaskoski (@BrentPiaskoski) April 1, 2011

You have to respect Howie Mandel for not wanting "Howie Do It" to be the worst show ever made. #Mobbed.

— Brent Piaskoski (@BrentPiaskoski) April 1, 2011

Jebus, I guess I better watch this #GreysAnatomy musical thing, nothing else on.

— Kel "Jingle Jangle Bells" K. (@TVKel) April 1, 2011

Some ghosts sing....some ghost have sex with hot blondes. Both make terrible TV. #GreysAnatomy

— Adam Wright (@TVDoneWright) April 1, 2011

Fuck. I do not hate this. I might, however, hate myself just a little bit. #GreysAnatomy

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) April 1, 2011

#greysanatomy judging from people's comments on Twitter, a lot of people haven't read a single thing about it be a musical episode

— Kel "Jingle Jangle Bells" K. (@TVKel) April 1, 2011

watching #greysanatomy ..why's everyone singing?

— Geezus (@InGeanWeTrust) April 1, 2011

Watching "Grey's Anatomy," it occurs to me I never credited "Law & Order" for going all those years without a musical episode.

— Ellen Gray (@elgray) April 1, 2011

So, like....seriously...WHAT the heck is going on with #GreysAnatomy's musical episode?! Stop singing! That's not your job, save her life!

— Carla Rubio (@CarlaRL_) April 1, 2011

I'm laughing but I can't lie I'm also crying. #GreysAnatomyMusical

— Sara Schaefer (@saraschaefer1) April 1, 2011

Casting directors of America (and beyond): Please do not cast Chyler Leigh in any musicals. Thank you and goodnight. #GreysAnatomy

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) April 1, 2011

#GreysAnatomy I wish I could quit you! But, I'm already sobbing just 5 minutes into this cornball musical episode. #embarrasedTVscholar

— Maria Suzanne Boyd (@ProfMariaBoyd) April 1, 2011

Addison is back. She's here to deliver this abortion of an episode? #GreysAnatomy

— Adam Wright (@TVDoneWright) April 1, 2011

If someone told me to calm down as I tried to save someones life and started singing right after, I'd slap him. I'd slap him sooo hard

— Bilal Mian (@Bilal_Mian) April 1, 2011

Oy with the Grey's. Is every patient at Mercy who is NOT having angsty random karaoke sung to them dead? Bc they may be the lucky ones.

— Emily Nussbaum (@emilynussbaum) April 1, 2011

The main problem with this episode is it appears to be directed by someone who has never seen a musical before in his life. #GreysAnatomy

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) April 1, 2011

Tonight's episode of #GreysAnatomy would be a lot more emotional if it weren't a musical.

— Bilal Mian (@Bilal_Mian) April 1, 2011

Holy shit, Grey's Anatomy. At least all the characters on Glee can SING. #stopit

— B Haynes (@barbhaynes) April 1, 2011

@TVDoneWright just wait til they cut to the #OffTheMap characters singing The Lion Sleeps Tonight

— Kyle Nolan (@kyool) April 1, 2011

If only we could auto-tune surgical skills. #GreysAnatomyMusical

— Sara Schaefer (@saraschaefer1) April 1, 2011

Tweets containing the words "ears are bleeding" have increased 1000 fold since #greysanatomy began.

— gladyssantiago (@gladyssantiago) April 1, 2011

Now a flashback? Is this Glee AND Lost now? #GreysAnatomy

— Adam Wright (@TVDoneWright) April 1, 2011

When are they going to sing "Everything Comes Down to Poo?" #greysanatomymusical

— Caroline (@fnerfette) April 1, 2011

So... now it's a singing and sex montage? With a lesbian couple in a van in the clouds? Sweet Xenu what a mess. #Greys

— B Haynes (@barbhaynes) April 1, 2011

Kevin McKidd, a great Scot actor. Amazing in Rome. Spoiled by Grey's Anatomy. Ruined by Grey's Anatomy: the Musical. #facts #greysAnatomy

— Rodrigo Beilfuss (@RBeilfuss) April 1, 2011

I love the weirdness of this episode. #GreysAnatomy

— NamelyNorm (@NamelyNorm) April 1, 2011

I'm SHOCKED Denny hasn't showed up yet in this disaster. #GreysAnatomy

— Adam Wright (@TVDoneWright) April 1, 2011

If I'm hurt, please take me to nearest hospital where staff doesn't lip-synch. #GreysAnatomy

— Ellen Gray (@elgray) April 1, 2011

This is the first time I've watched tv live and welcomed the commercials #greysanatomymusical

— 👿 Krampus Lucarelli ☃ (@KristinaLuca) April 1, 2011

#GreysAnatomy is putting the breakthrough of a successful mainstream lesbian musical further out of reach

— Kel "Jingle Jangle Bells" K. (@TVKel) April 1, 2011

The break from traumatic injuries for everybody to bang each other in well-lit rooms was unexpected. #greysanatomymusical

— Topher Payne (@topherpayne) April 1, 2011

@TVKel We get it. You hate the episode. Change the channel already.

— G~ (@GinaRClark) April 1, 2011

Maybe I should change the channel, but pissing off #GreysAnatomy fans is so much fun.

— Kel "Jingle Jangle Bells" K. (@TVKel) April 1, 2011

This song is kind of gorgeous. I might download it, all legal-like. #GreysAnatomy

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) April 1, 2011

Why is Ghost Callie also camera aware? She's like the Lea Michele of #GreysAnatomy

— Adam Wright (@TVDoneWright) April 1, 2011

Kevin McKidd you just RUINEDDDDDDD The Fray for me. RUINEDDDD!!! #GreysAnatomy

— Bilal Mian (@Bilal_Mian) April 1, 2011

This is suppose to be a teaching hospital. No wonder they've fallen down in the ranking. #GreysAnatomy

— Adam Wright (@TVDoneWright) April 1, 2011

Marc cannot sing! Wow...he's the Finn. #GreysAnatomy

— Adam Wright (@TVDoneWright) April 1, 2011

Step 1. Be off pitch. Step 2. Harmonize. Step 3. CRASH CARTTT!!!!!!!! #GreysAnatomy

— Bilal Mian (@Bilal_Mian) April 1, 2011

They all sound like they are drunk at a karaoke bar! Back away from the scalpels! #GreysAnatomy

— Kel "Jingle Jangle Bells" K. (@TVKel) April 1, 2011

Are they really going to sing over THIS?!? Really?!? #GreysAnatomy

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) April 1, 2011

Wait...where's Addison? Did she run away after seeing the craziness? Smart girl. #GreysAnatomy

— Adam Wright (@TVDoneWright) April 1, 2011

Really hoping they end with a Black-Eyed Peas song. #GreysAnatomyMusical

— Sara Schaefer (@saraschaefer1) April 1, 2011

@TVKel I like #GreysAnatomy but twitter is the only thing making this ep entertaining--wish I had twitter during the Danny Duquette years!

— Kyle Nolan (@kyool) April 1, 2011

Awesome concept, well-shot, well-performed. But song lyrics made no fucking sense in the story. So, um, there was that. #greysanatomymusical

— Topher Payne (@topherpayne) April 1, 2011

Yes Meredith, let's make this alllll about you. #GreysAnatomy

— Adam Wright (@TVDoneWright) April 1, 2011

"I was in Sideways you assholes!!" - Sandra Oh at the table read for the #GreysAnatomyMusical

— Sara Schaefer (@saraschaefer1) April 1, 2011

Shit. #Grey's Anatomy is making me cry again. And for the record. I'd marry Sara Ramirez too. wow. just wow.

Sara Ramirez just became Casey Abrams...in the worst possible way. Ha'

— Kath Skerry (@KathSkerry) April 1, 2011

If only they'd pre-empted #GreysAnatomy for a night and given Sara Ramirez a concert special.

— Ellen Gray (@elgray) April 1, 2011

I love imagining how long it took Sara Ramirez (Callie) to convince everyone this was a good idea. #GreysAnatomyMusical

— Sara Schaefer (@saraschaefer1) April 1, 2011

Sweet God, can one of these fake doctors give the show a Do Not Resuscitate order? #GreysAnatomy

— B Haynes (@barbhaynes) April 1, 2011

@TVDoneWright You know how they say "don't mix your drinks"? Well same applies to TV shows. Glee on one side and #GreysAnatomy on the other.

— Abi Reid (@AbiJPReid) April 1, 2011

Oh, Grey's Anatomy musical event. Never change.

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) April 1, 2011

Next week the #GLEE kids will be performing open heart surgery with equally disastrous results. turn around is fail play #GreysAnatomy

— Masked Scheduler (@maskedscheduler) April 1, 2011

Somedays I am convinced Archer is the best show on television. Then Timothy Olyphant takes his shirt off.

— woolyknickers (@woolyknickers) April 1, 2011

Tonight, @MargaretAtwood said that she should watch more reality tv. Therefore, I've done my job.

Tonight: An important message for @FoxNews. The opinion is coming from INSIDE the news department!

#Camelot spoiler: You have to wait eight minutes to see boobs. I don't even know why we HAVE pay cable. #iwillstopnow

#Camelot spoiler: You have to wait eight minutes to see boobs. I don't even know why we HAVE pay cable. #iwillstopnow

With the shit that comes out of Hollywood sometimes, it's gonna be tricky working out which news articles are April fools' jokes today.
